get.description:
Returns a list of assets and their vulnerability totals (critical/high/medium/low/info), along with basic asset metadata.

**Authentication**: Send an `Authorization` header in the format:
`access_token {token}`

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description: Optional filter for the type of asset to include (for example: agent-based, IP-based, webapp). If omitted, all supported asset types are returned.

get.summary: Get internal authenticated scan details for an asset
get.description:
Returns vulnerability findings for a single asset based on the **Internal Authenticated** scan type.

Use this endpoint when you already know the asset identifier and want detailed CVE/root-cause information.

**Authentication**: Send an `Authorization` header in the format:
`access_token {token}`

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: Asset identifier to fetch details for (Internal Authenticated scan).

get.summary: Get vulnerability details for an IP address (unauthenticated/external)
get.description:
Returns vulnerability findings for a device identified by IP address, based on **Internal Unauthenticated** and/or **External** scanning.

Use this endpoint when you want details for a specific discovered IP.

**Authentication**: Send an `Authorization` header in the format:
`access_token {token}`

parameters.name: assetIp
parameters.description: The IPv4/IPv6 address to look up (for example: `192.0.2.10`).

get.summary: Get web application scan findings for an asset
get.description:
Returns web application vulnerability findings (for example: URL-based issues) for a specific asset.

Use this endpoint to retrieve the findings list and counts for a web application scan.

**Authentication**: Send an `Authorization` header in the format:
`access_token {token}`

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: Asset identifier to fetch web application findings for.
